subject: AI & Agents
title: When to Switch Models Instead of Prompts
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on When to Switch Models Instead of Prompts.

hook.text: You've rewritten the prompt 20 times. Maybe the problem isn't the prompt.

buildup.text: Different models have different strengths: reasoning, speed, cost, context length.

discovery.text: A smaller model + great prompt often beats a large model + lazy prompt on cost.

twist.text: But some tasks genuinely need a frontier model. Know when to upgrade, not just tweak.

climax.text: Build a simple eval: run 20 test cases on 2â€“3 models. Pick by accuracy-per-dollar.

punchline.text: The best prompt hack is sometimes a better model.

quiz.question: When should you consider switching models?
options: When prompt rewrites no longer improve output
